=JSON NFL Game Stats=

Converts the NFL's JSON game stats into a data structure that is easy to work with.

== How to use ==
 # [http://code.google.com/p/nfl-game-stats/downloads/list Download] and add nfl_game_stats-1.1.js and day_hours.js to your html
{{{
 <script type="text/javascript" src="day_hours.js"></script>
 <script type="text/javascript" src="nfl_game_stats.js"></script>
}}}
 # Make a request to [http://www.nfl.com/liveupdate/scorestrip/scorestrip.json] during the regular season or [http://www.nfl.com/liveupdate/scorestrip/postseason/scorestrip.json] during the post season.
 # Find empty elements and replace with quotes ("")
{{{
 while (preProcessedResponseText.search(/,,/) != -1) {
   preProcessedResponseText = preProcessedResponseText.replace(/,,/g, ",\"\",");
 }
}}}
 # Parse the response and call getGameStats
{{{
 var response = JSON.parse(preProcessedResponseText);
 var stats = getGameStats(response.ss);
}}}
 # Use the returned array of [http://code.google.com/p/nfl-game-stats/wiki/GameStatsAPI game stats] as you please.
